image.altText: A large white and red ship docked in Hobart.

props.synopsis: When asked about TT-Line's insolvency and whether he was "aware of anything that has made them solvent again", Tasmania's auditor-general has said "the short answer is 'no'."

title.children: Spirit of Tasmania operator still insolvent, auditor-general says

image.altText: Primary school students

props.synopsis: At least six Tasmanian Catholic Education schools will be closed and three others partially closed on Tuesday due to the national recall of coloured sand products over asbestos contamination.

title.children: Nine Tasmanian Catholic schools to close on Tuesday

image.altText: Deepinderjeet 'Deep' Singh sits at a table.

props.synopsis: A 19-year-old has been sentenced to four years in jail after pleading guilty to the 2024 drowning death of student Deepinderjeet Singh, after he pushed him into the river at Hobart's waterfront.

title.children: 'Random and pointless' actions led to drowning death of UTAS student, judge says

image.altText: A general view of the Gabba with a yellow football in the foreground.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian Sports Minister Nick Duigan has admitted he reneged on plans to give North Launceston Football Club $100,000 after the club's president did a media conference with Labor.

title.children: Liberal minister reneged on footy funding after club attended Labor presser

image.altText: A man holds a Southern rock lobster

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government closed two zones within the state's rock lobster fishery just hours after the commercial season opened. The closure is in response to concerns about an antibiotic being used by salmon companies and the rock lobster industry's reputation in overseas markets.

title.children: Salmon antibiotic leads to partial rock lobster fishery closure

image.altText: A dozen sail boats make their way through the Sydney Harbour.

props.synopsis: A crew of nine set out on the 1998 Sydney to Hobart yacht race on the Winston Churchill amid warnings of dangerous weather. Only six of them survived.

title.children: The dark past of the Sydney to Hobart yacht race

image.altText: Generic photos of a mental health facility.

props.synopsis: A $2 million transitional funding injection from the Tasmanian government has allowed The Hobart Clinic to treat patients for six more months while it comes up with a sustainable business model.

title.children: Hobart private mental health clinic reopens after 17-day closure

image.altText: Eight ambulances parked in rows at the Royal Hobart Hospital emergency department.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government's "ban" on ambulance ramping was announced with much fanfare in 2024 — but there has been no effect on ambulance response times, and patients are still facing long waits in hospital emergency departments.

title.children: How is Tasmania's ambulance ramping 'ban' going?

image.altText: Asbestos clean up Canberra 2025-11-17 11:11:00

props.synopsis: Dozens of public schools in the ACT will reopen or partially open tomorrow, but 25 remain closed for all students.

title.children: Schools closed in ACT, SA and Tasmania over coloured sand recalls

image.altText: A broad view of houses with solar panels on rooftop

props.synopsis: When there is an oversupply of solar and wind power, energy producers are paying more to deliver electricity to households than they get paid. Here's what we know about how it affects you.

title.children: Renewable energy generators need to cut out when sun blazes and wind blows

image.altText: A 4WD vehicle parked at an amenities shed in the outback surrounded by trees and mountains in the background.

props.synopsis: A couple travelling through Central Australia have been reported as missing for the past four days. The tourists were last seen at Finke Gorge National Park near Alice Springs.

title.children: Couple travelling through Central Australia missing for four days

image.altText: Ariana Grande arrives at the 16th Governors Awards in LA

props.synopsis: Johnson Wen, who is alleged to have disrupted other global sports events and concerts, has shown "a pattern of behaviour", according to a Singapore court judge.

title.children: Australian man who grabbed Ariana Grande at premiere jailed for nine days

image.altText: A man wearing dark sunglasses and a black jacket

props.synopsis: The federal government has revoked the visa of a man who attended the far-right National Socialist Network protest at NSW's parliament house.

title.children: 'Time to go home': Visa of man who attended Neo-Nazi protest revoked

image.altText: Jamarra Ugle-Hagan and the 2020 AFL draft class

props.synopsis: It is the AFL draft that has become a cautionary tale to clubs. Five years on from the infamous 2020 draft, here is the story on the tumultuous year from those involved in it.

title.children: 'A year of turmoil': Inside the AFL's infamous 2020 COVID draft

image.altText: Bangladeshi Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina is speaking in a conference

props.synopsis: A Bangladesh court has sentenced ousted prime minister Sheikh Hasina to death after finding her guilty of crimes against humanity.

title.children: Bangladesh court issues death sentence against ex-PM who fled country

image.altText: A man in cold weather gear throwing a bag out of a burnt out balcony window.

props.synopsis: Moscow is intensifying its strikes on Ukraine, targeting the country's energy infrastructure ahead of winter.

title.children: Ukraine signs 'historic' fighter jets deal as Russian strikes intensify

image.altText: Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain in a mohair cardigan, sitting with a semi-acoustic guitar for MTV's Unplugged.

props.synopsis: It was nearly a disaster, but Nirvana going acoustic for MTV ended up being one of the most iconic live performances ever and cemented Kurt Cobain as a tortured genius.

title.children: The night Nirvana made history — and Kurt Cobain thought he blew it

image.altText: a small old urn

props.synopsis: Ahead of the 2025/26 Ashes series getting underway on November 21 in Perth, test out your knowledge in our fiendish Ashes quiz.

title.children: Think you know the Ashes? Try our fiendish quiz to find out

image.altText: A woman smiles at the camera while sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: Ava Costa's spinal injury sparked an outpouring of support from the gymnastics community. Now the teenager wants to ensure others can spend less time in hospital.

title.children: Former gymnast's mission to rehome disability equipment

image.altText: A group of men walk alongside a stationary train with police tape alongside the track

props.synopsis: The track is a vital link for supplies to reach Ukraine, with the incident the latest in a wave of similar attacks across Europe since Russia's invasion began.

title.children: Railway track blast in Poland 'unprecedented act of sabotage', Polish PM says

image.altText: Profile of Penny Wong.

props.synopsis: The foreign minister has used a major speech to celebrate the government's string of security agreements, saying Labor has helped build a region more stable and less deferential to authoritarian powers like Russia and China.

title.children: Wong says Australia the 'architect' in the region after 'landmark' achievements

image.altText: A woman in a black and white patterned jacket talks into a microphone at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Tokyo has sent a senior foreign ministry official to Beijing to try and ease tensions, that have seen threats made against Japan's prime minister.

title.children: Japan moves to cool tensions with China amid diplomatic spat over Taiwan

image.altText: Paige Greco holds her gold medal and smiles

props.synopsis: Australian Paralympian Paige Greco, who won Australia's first gold medal of the 2020 Tokyo Paralympic Games, has died aged 28.

title.children: Paralympic and world champion Paige Greco dies, aged 28

image.altText: The letters BBC over the front doors to an office building

props.synopsis: The US president says he could sue the British national broadcaster for as much as $US5 billion.

title.children: BBC 'determined to fight' Trump lawsuit over documentary edit

image.altText: a white hard hat with rio tinto written in red

props.synopsis: Mining giant Rio Tinto scraps a $215 million research centre and green steel project touted last year as a key staging ground for the world's net zero transition.

title.children: Rio Tinto shelves $215m green steel project after decade of development

image.altText: A black swan, its neck bent back along its body.

props.synopsis: An unlikely patient in Alice Springs is returned to the water treatment ponds two weeks after being found injured from a suspected dog attack.

title.children: Black swan 'Jandal' survives suspected dog attack in outback Australia

image.altText: Workers in high-viz clothing and helmets work at the site of a landslide

props.synopsis: Multiple landslides have engulfed communities in Central Java, with hundreds of emergency workers involved in the rescue operations.

title.children: At least 18 killed by landslides in Indonesia as rescue efforts continue

image.altText: Cyclone map 2

props.synopsis: The chance of a cyclone forming off the Northern Territory coast this week is now high, the Bureau of Meteorology is forecasting, with Darwin potentially impacted.

title.children: BOM forecasts high chance of a cyclone off the NT, potentially impacting Darwin

image.altText: A sign on top of one of the buildings at Princess Alexandra Hospital in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Health ministers are furious with a letter from the prime minister demanding they rein in spending if they want a public hospital funding deal honoured.

title.children: 'Beyond belief': PM tells states to spend less on hospitals

image.altText: A man with dark hair in a navy jacket and white collared shirt with no tie stares at the camera in a park.

props.synopsis: The opposition leader was informed by a delegation of MPs that he had lost the support of the party room, less than 12 months into his tenure as leader and just over a year out from the state election.

title.children: Victorian Liberal leader Brad Battin facing leadership challenge

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese wears black-rimmed glasses and a black suit jacket with a silver tie.

props.synopsis: As Chris Bowen lands in Belém with the clock ticking on a resolution, Anthony Albanese says the rules against co-presidency for the COP are clear.

title.children: Sharing COP presidency with Türkiye 'not an option', says Albanese

image.altText: A white man, black polo shirt, sunglasses walking, blonde-haired woman crouched next to him

props.synopsis: Three Northern Territory residents who were charged on Friday over allegations of a $71 million Defence contract fraud scheme have been granted bail.

title.children: Names of three people charged over alleged $71 million fraud scheme revealed

image.altText: A photo of abstract artwork blue poles, which is made up of drips of red, yellow, white and black paint

props.synopsis: Art can stir strong feelings in people, both good and bad. These artworks fell in the latter, provoking great controversy in Australia, and telling us a lot about who we are as a nation.

title.children: These six artworks caused huge controversy in Australia

image.altText: A close shot of a hereford cow

props.synopsis: Shoppers at home and abroad are unlikely to see any immediate change in the price of Australian beef as tariffs that did little to curb demand in the first place are lifted.

title.children: Price of Australian beef unlikely to change as Trump ends tariffs

image.altText: Two smashed derby cars.

props.synopsis: New scrutiny is expected in the demolition derby industry after a crash that injured 13 people in northern NSW.

title.children: Sport to be 'picked apart with a fine-tooth comb' following crash
